p: Although the majority of molecular mechanisms responsible for the neurotropism of MBF infection remain unknown, in silico methods are emerging as promising tools to aid in the investigation of host-pathogen interactions that contribute to pathogenesis of MBF infection. An in silico genetic screening approach was recently utilized to elucidate that ZIKV-elicited congenital microcephaly may act through dysregulation of the retinoic acid response element (RARE) (Kumar et al., 2016). In addition, in silico analysis has been employed to investigate the role of both viral and human microRNA in congenital ZIKV microcephaly (Pylro et al., 2016).
